title: Cybersecurity Solutions Architect - Corp Tech and Solutions
content:
Harmonia Holdings Group, LLC is an award-winning minority and female owned federal government contractor committed to providing innovative, high-performing solutions to our government clients and focused on fostering a workplace that encourages growth, initiative, creativity, and employee satisfaction.  We are currently seeking a Solutions Architect to join our Corporate Technology and Solutions group. This position is focused on pursuit engineering. The Solution Architect (SA) will work collaboratively with the capture manager, the program/ portfolio managers, subject matter experts (SMEs) to drive win strategy, shaping, solutioning, and proposing integrated winning solutions for large/ strategic captures for new business and re-competes in our market areas. The SA will host/ facilitate discovery sessions to identify, propose strengths and differentiators. The SA relies on technical SMEs, understands Harmonia capabilities to develop technical solutions that address customer hot buttons, win themes - the comprehensive story of a bid.
The Technology and Solutions group SAs may work on multiple pursuits at any given time or be focused on a large bid along with other SAs. If you have a passion to interact with cross functional teams, lead sessions to understand the customer challenges, Harmonia capabilities/ gaps and are smart to identify strengths and discriminators to craft an integrated forward-thinking solution - then we want to hear from you. You will work with competent and motivated professionals, be managed, and supported by a team that values your skills and commitment and be rewarded financially for your efforts. Compensation is performance-based.
As Solution Architect you will:

You will collaborate with the core capture team to lead the discovery of customer missions, challenges and Harmonia capabilities, gaps to recommend teaming, shaping and potential strengths-based solutions as applicable.
You will conceptualize, develop, communicate, and propose solutions that will drive our growth and lead directly to top and bottom-line results.
You will work with clients in both a long-lead and tactical capacity to help solve their critical needs and challenges.
You will understand Harmonia capabilities and leverage them to create differentiating solutions to meet client requirements and challenges.
These solutions may require knowledge of hardware, software, networking, cloud architectures, aerospace, communications, cyber, electrical, manufacturing, mechanical, or other specialized engineering domains to design, develop, and support integrated solutions for Civilian and DOD clients. You will work with SMEs in many of these areas to determine the optimum approach, methodology, tools, architectures to develop an innovative, integrated & comprehensive technical and non-technical solution.
In partnership with others, you will define total systems design and technology maturity constraints in accordance with mission requirements, develop system element architecture and design and interface definitions, define system implementation approaches and operational concepts

Required Skills:

Must have 5 yrs. of strong experience or expertise in Cybersecurity technologies, frameworks, regulations, and processes, etc.
Knowledge of Windows, UNIX, and Linux
Understanding of ISO 27001/27002, ITIL, and COBIT frameworks
A grasp of perimeter security controls such as firewalls, IDS/IPS, network access controls, and network segmentation
Network security architecture development and definition
Experience with the various aspects of wireless security such as routers, switches, and VLAN security
Knowledge of security concepts related to DNS, including routing, authentication, VPN, proxy services, and DDOS mitigation technology
An understanding of third-party auditing and cloud risk assessment methodology
Working knowledge of Cyber: NIST 800/53 security controls, benefits of FedRAMP
Desired experience and skills to include (but not limited to) Software Architecture, Cloud, Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, and Robotic Process Automation.
Experience with DevSecOps, Infrastructure as Code (IAC) Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD
Must have experience working front-end solutioning with clients to include assessing needs from requirements (SOW, SOO, PWS, other Draft material), good communication and relationship skills, determining pain points and key client needs, etc.
The ability to identify strengths, weaknesses, gaps when the technical solutions are discussed/ presented by different SMEs/vendors.

 Recommended Skills:

Awareness of a breadth of current technologies and capabilities employed in the Federal Government, sufficient to grasp the technical details from a SME and integrate the relevant aspects into a comprehensive solution.
Leadership skills to operate, manage, guide, and influence cross functional and P&L teams on proposing and implementing innovative solutions.
Excellent oral and written communication skills with experience interacting/ presenting to executive/ senior management.
Must have demonstrated experience developing and solutioning for winning proposals for new and re-compete business pursuits, capture activities and proposal efforts.
Must have participated in and authored as a Solution Architect, portions of the Technical and/or Management Volumes of mid to large proposals for the Federal Government.
Use and understanding of a standard Shipley-type proposal approach

Education and Experience:

Bachelorâ€™s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or a related major.
7+ years' experience specifically leading, developing, shaping, and writing solutions for large proposal efforts.
A minimum of 3years in a professional senior technical role such as technical lead, team lead, architect, or any other hands-on leadership role
Preferred CISSP Certification
As per the Executive Order on Ensuring Adequate Covid Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors and regulations as detailed by www.saferfederalworkforce.gov , it is recommended that all federal government contractors be vaccinated against Covid-19, unless approved for an exemption/ accommodation on the basis of a sincerely held religious belief or medical circumstance.
